meanings.definition: To fall or lie down heavily and noisily
meanings.sent1: The tired dog will flop onto the soft bed.
meanings.sent2: She watched the leaves flop to the ground in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent3: After a long day, he decided to flop onto the couch and relax.
meanings.sent4: The exhausted runner's legs felt like they would flop beneath him.
meanings.sent5: The heavy book made her arms flop down as she tried to lift it.

meanings.sent1: The movie was a flop at the box office, receiving poor reviews.
meanings.sent2: The business investment turned out to be a flop, causing financial losses.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at a joke was a flop, leaving everyone silent.
meanings.sent4: The party was a flop with no one showing up to celebrate.
meanings.sent5: The new product launch was a flop, leading to disappointment among customers.

meanings.sent1: The curtains flop in the breeze coming through the window.
meanings.sent2: Her hair would flop around as she danced energetically.
meanings.sent3: The floppy hat would flop over her eyes whenever the wind blew.
meanings.sent4: The fish would flop around in the boat before being released back into the water.
meanings.sent5: The loose sleeves of the shirt would flop as she raised her arms.

meanings.definition: A sudden or heavy fall or drop
meanings.sent1: The flop of the rock into the pond created ripples on the surface.
meanings.sent2: The loud flop of the box hitting the floor startled the cat.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected flop of the market caused panic among investors.
meanings.sent4: The flop of the basketball through the hoop scored the winning point.
meanings.sent5: The flop of the rain on the roof made a soothing sound as she fell asleep.
